channel.title: Guidelines on Calypso
channel.description: Recent content in Guidelines on Calypso

item.title: CSS Style Guide
item.description: We follow a slightly modified version of airbnb’s style guide. Only Use Classes IDs are not reusable and add unnecessary weight to the hierarchy. Elements are not specific enough. Bad This has a weight of 1 ID, 1 class, and 1 element which will require an equal amount of the same items to override. #block .element a #block { .element { a { stuff } } } Good This has a weight of 1 class.

item.title: CSS Best Practices
item.description: Theming Theming is a way to use variables to reduce repetition and improve quality of life. A list of color variables for example, can be used as values for other semantic variables. Example In variables.less we have this: @color-blue-primary: #006298; @color-white: #ffffff; @button-primary-bg: @color-blue-primary; @button-primary-text: @color-white; In practice, we would use it like this: .button_primary { background-color: @button-primary-bg; color: @button-primary-text; } Which allows us to simply change the value of @button-primary-bg when the theme requires a different color instead of finding all the places @color-blue-primary is used.

item.title: UX Resources
item.description: Design Assets UX Google Drive InVision Mockups Sketch Library Font Awesome Pro Research Assets Product User Test Findings Testing Scripts Analytics Google Analytics Foresee Tools Sketch Craft Plant Axure InVision Adobe Creative Cloud

"CSS Style Guide" We follow a slightly modified version of airbnb’s style guide. Only Use Classes IDs are not reusable and add unnecessary weight to the hierarchy. Elements are not specific enough. Bad This has a weight of 1 ID, 1 class, and 1 element which will require an equal amount of the same items to override. #block .element a #block { .element { a { stuff } } } Good This has a weight of 1 class.

"CSS Best Practices" Theming Theming is a way to use variables to reduce repetition and improve quality of life. A list of color variables for example, can be used as values for other semantic variables. Example In variables.less we have this: @color-blue-primary: #006298; @color-white: #ffffff; @button-primary-bg: @color-blue-primary; @button-primary-text: @color-white; In practice, we would use it like this: .button_primary { background-color: @button-primary-bg; color: @button-primary-text; } Which allows us to simply change the value of @button-primary-bg when the theme requires a different color instead of finding all the places @color-blue-primary is used.
